text: Anthony Liscio (July 2, 1940 â€“ June 18, 2017) was an American football offensive tackle in the National Football League for the Dallas Cowboys from 1963 through 1971. He played college football at the University of Tulsa. He was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Liscio died from complications from ALS in Dallas, Texas on June 18, 2017 at the age of 76.Tony Liscio, ex-Cowboy who protected Roger Staubach's blind side, dies at 76 after battling ALS ==References== ==Other websites== *Luring Tony Liscio out of retirement paid off for Liscio and Cowboys *Trading wasn't always so difficult in the NFL *Tulsa Hurricanes bio Category:1940 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from motor neurone disease Category:Green Bay Packers players Category:Dallas Cowboys players Category:Sportspeople from Pittsburgh
title: Tony Liscio
